description:
Do these sports-crossed lovers have a chance?

Taiki Inomata loves badminton, but he has a long way to go before he can reach nationals. When Taiki sees upperclassman Chinatsu Kano practicing her heart out on the girls’ basketball team, he falls for her hard. After an unexpected turn of events brings the two closer together, sports might not be the first thing on their minds anymore!

(Source: TMS Anime)

Note: The series streamed a week in advance on Netflix Japan starting with episode 2 released alongside episode 1.
synonyms: กล่องรักวัยใส

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Coming of Age
tags.description: Centers around a character's transition from childhood to adulthood.

tags.description: Partly or completely set in a school club scene.

tags.description: Centers around sporting events that involve competitive running, jumping, throwing, or walking.

tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of teen characters.

tags.description: Centers around the sport of badminton.

tags.description: One or more characters are experiencing an unrequited love that may or may not be reciprocated.

tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

tags.name: Love Triangle
tags.description: Centered around romantic feelings between more than two people. Includes all love polygons.

tags.name: Cohabitation
tags.description: Features two or more people who live in the same household and develop a romantic or sexual relationship.

tags.description: The art of jumping, tumbling, and balancing. Often paired with trapeze, trampolining, tightropes, or general gymnastics.

tags.description: Features "super deformed" character designs with smaller, rounder proportions and a cute look.

node.description:
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/Amzk0303)

Studied art at Musashino Art University.

Not to be mistaken with another [Kouji Miura (三浦浩児)](https://anilist.co/staff/221325/Kouji-Miura) who is a scriptwriter.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/tanino_miho) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/tanino_miho/)

Animator and designer affiliated to [Telecom Animation Film](https://anilist.co/studio/94/Telecom-Animation-Film)

__[Website](http://eveofficial.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/oo0Eve0oo) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/eve_harapeco/) | [YouTube](http://www.youtube.com/user/ooo0eve0ooo)__

__Introduction:__
Eve is a Japanese utaite, mangaka, fashion designer, vocalist, guitarist, lyricist and composer under record label TOY'S FACTORY (2019–), having previously been under record label harapeco records (2016–2018). He works closely with the arranger [Tomoki Numano](https://anilist.co/staff/137906/Tomoki-Numano), otherwise known as Numa, who arranges most of his songs.

__Biography:__
He first started uploading covers on NicoNico Douga in April 2009 at the age of 13. Aside from covering songs, he was one of the lead singers for the Japanese indie band einie, alongside Natsushiro Takaaki; he also composed songs and wrote lyrics for the band. 

He started going by the name Eve in October 2009; before that, he had gone by the names Keitora and Kurowa. He also plays the acoustic guitar and sometimes accompanies his songs with his own acoustic arrangements.

[Website](https://higedan.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/officialhige) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/officialhigedandism) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/officialhigedandism/) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC3vg17IZ1IV73xx069jG44w) | [Spotify](https://open.spotify.com/artist/5Vo1hnCRmCM6M4thZCInCj)

__Official Hige Dandism__ (Official髭男dism, stylized as Official HIGE DANdism), commonly abbreviated __Higedan__ (ヒゲダン), is a Japanese pop band formed in Shimane, Japan in 2012.

After signing a record deal with the major label Pony Canyon in 2018, Official Hige Dandism released the debut single _"No Doubt"_, the lead single from the extended play, Stand by You EP. The following year, the band released the second single, _"Pretender"_, which ranked at number three on the year-end chart of Billboard Japan Hot 100 in 2019. Their debut studio album Traveler was released on 9 October 2019 and reached number one on the Japan Albums Chart.

(Source: Wikipedia)

__Members:__
• [Satoshi Fujihara](https://anilist.co/staff/277082) (藤原聡) - born August 19, 1991 (lead vocals, piano)
• Daisuke Ozasa (小笹大輔) - born January 6, 1994 (lead guitar, backing vocals)
• Makoto Narazaki (楢﨑誠) - born March 18, 1989 (bass, saxophone, backing vocals)
• Masaki Matsuura (松浦匡希) - born January 22, 1993 (drums, percussion, backing vocals)

[Profile](https://www.nichionsakka.com/takashi-ohmama) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/takashi_ohmama) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/takashi_ohmama/) | [Spotify](https://open.spotify.com/artist/08JdrX1itYADF3msockY6y)

Composer belonging to composer management NIchion.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/明田川仁)

Affiliated with Magic Capsule, a recording studio led by his father [Susumu Aketagawa](https://anilist.co/staff/120062).
Initially an animator at [Telecom Animation Film](https://anilist.co/studio/94/).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/tanino_miho) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/tanino_miho/)

Animator and designer affiliated to [Telecom Animation Film](https://anilist.co/studio/94/Telecom-Animation-Film)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/265406784) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/tetsuro.araki.75)

Joined [MADHOUSE](https://anilist.co/studio/11/MADHOUSE) in 1999 as a production manager, making his storyboard and episode director debut with [Galaxy Angel](https://anilist.co/anime/383/) just two years later. In 2005, he made his proper directorial debut with [Otogi-juushi Akazukin](https://anilist.co/anime/402/), a single-episode OVA which was aimed more at figure collectors than at anime fans. Its popularity birthed the full-length series and manga which both came out afterwards.

In 2006, Araki helmed his first big project with [Death Note](https://anilist.co/anime/1535/), which gained him international praise. He has since gone on to direct numerous series from originals such as [Guilty Crown](https://anilist.co/anime/10793/) and [Kabaneri of the Iron Fortress](https://anilist.co/anime/21196/), to the massively successful adaptation of [Attack on Titan](https://anilist.co/anime/16498/), whose production Araki left with the studio change.

He's been close friends with [Takayuki Hirao](https://anilist.co/staff/102247/) since their days at [MADHOUSE](https://anilist.co/studio/11/). The two have frequently collaborated on numerous projects.

Married to [Aya Hida](https://anilist.co/staff/144626/).

Freelance, however primarily works at [WIT Studio](https://anilist.co/studio/858/) with Animation Producer [Kazuki Yamanaka](https://anilist.co/staff/196459/).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/265406784) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/tetsuro.araki.75)

Joined [MADHOUSE](https://anilist.co/studio/11/MADHOUSE) in 1999 as a production manager, making his storyboard and episode director debut with [Galaxy Angel](https://anilist.co/anime/383/) just two years later. In 2005, he made his proper directorial debut with [Otogi-juushi Akazukin](https://anilist.co/anime/402/), a single-episode OVA which was aimed more at figure collectors than at anime fans. Its popularity birthed the full-length series and manga which both came out afterwards.

In 2006, Araki helmed his first big project with [Death Note](https://anilist.co/anime/1535/), which gained him international praise. He has since gone on to direct numerous series from originals such as [Guilty Crown](https://anilist.co/anime/10793/) and [Kabaneri of the Iron Fortress](https://anilist.co/anime/21196/), to the massively successful adaptation of [Attack on Titan](https://anilist.co/anime/16498/), whose production Araki left with the studio change.

He's been close friends with [Takayuki Hirao](https://anilist.co/staff/102247/) since their days at [MADHOUSE](https://anilist.co/studio/11/). The two have frequently collaborated on numerous projects.

Married to [Aya Hida](https://anilist.co/staff/144626/).

Freelance, however primarily works at [WIT Studio](https://anilist.co/studio/858/) with Animation Producer [Kazuki Yamanaka](https://anilist.co/staff/196459/).

[Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/schubert_rafael/) | [Facebook](https://facebook.com/rafael.schubert) | [Youtube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCW0dyHVmLDuT290br9R38Ww) | [Twitch](https://www.twitch.tv/rafaelschubert) | [IMDb](https://www.imdb.com/name/nm9623518)

Rafael Schubert is a Brazilian actor, voice actor, dubbing director, photographer, screenwriter, and streamer.

__Non-Anime Roles:__
~!- Nicholas "Nick" Arsenio Birch (Big Mouth)
- Dylan Lenivy (The Quarry)
- Sa Hye-Jun (Record of Youth)
- Wayne (Total Drama Island 2023)
- Sonic the Hedgehog (3rd dub; Adventures of Sonic the Hedgehog)
- John Gallagher Jr. (Gone in the Night and Abandoned)
- Randy Meeks (4th dub; Scream 2)
- Omar (The Walking Dead: The Final Season)
!~

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/jezzylw) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/jezzylush/)

A Mexican voice actress. She is known for being the voice of Marinette in _Miraculous: Tales of Ladybug & Cat Noir_, Katniss Everdeen in _The Hunger Games_, Teddy Duncan in _Good Luck Charlie_ and Carol Danvers in the _Marvel Cinematic Universe_.

She is the younger sister of [Diego Ángeles](https://anilist.co/staff/281238/Diego-ngeles)

**Non-Anime Roles:**
- Zelda (The Legend of Zelda)
- Rio Morales and Felicia Hardy / Black Cat  (Spider-Man)
- Xayah (League of Legends)
